definition: Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

sentences.english: The Battle of Kursk had ended just two weeks before.
sentences.chinese: 库尔斯克战役刚过去两周。

sentences.english: German troops have started fighting near Kursk.
sentences.chinese: 德军在库尔斯克附近发起战斗。

sentences.english: The German offensive near Kursk fails.
sentences.chinese: 德军在库尔斯克的进攻失败了。

pinyin: Sai1 wa3 si1 tuo1 bo1 er3

definition: Stalingrad, former name of Volvograd 伏爾加格勒|伏尔加格勒 (1925-1961)
Leningrad, name of Russian city Saint Petersburg 聖彼得堡|圣彼得堡 1923-1991

Battle of Stalingrad (1942-1943), decisive battle of Second World War and one of the bloodiest battles in history, when the Germans failed to take Stalingrad, were then trapped and destroyed by Soviet forces
pinyin: Si1 da4 lin2 ge2 le4 Zhan4 yi4

definition: the Ural mountains in Russia, dividing Europe from Asia
the Yom Kippur war of October 1973 between Israel and her Arab neighbors
Sea of Azov in southern Russia
